title: Not a good option for people with mobility issues.
body: We visited Hadley wood for a CT scan , whilst the receptionists were very helpful and accomodatong ,the actual staff at the CT scan room were not , we were told categorically no immobile patients as they do not have any equipments or walking aids to support anyone .We were told this Hospital is not for us and why were we referred here.We explained the GP  referred us here and we only attended as letter said. As we came by transport  we were told such patients werent even welcomed here  people who need transport as they dont have the facilities. If this is a Hospital am wondering why people with mobility issues are not catered for as we were told today..

title: Impressed
body:
I was in considerable pain today due to a long term health condition and additionally, a distressing inner ear problem.
After phoning the Practice I was surprised to get a call back (relatively quickly) from a GP, furthermore, an appointment was offered for the same day.

The Dr I saw was understanding, absolutely thorough in his examination and I felt extremely confident in his diagnosis/treatment. 
Thank you, it means a lot.

title: Awful Reception Staff
body:
Having been a patient of this surgery for over 35 years it's difficult for me to do this, however, I have found the reception staff, one in particular extremely rude and unhelpful.

The reception staff do not listen and simply cut you off when talking.

The Dr's mainly Dr Anten is the saviour of this surgery. I have found her approach professional, thorough and caring.

title: Fantastic Experience
body: The staff who were on shift today as a had a cystoscopy were fantastic. I was reassured at every level and my concerns were listened too. Staff were genuinely lovely and you could tell they loved their jobs and worked as a team. The toast and tea after my procedure were the best! Thank you and keep up the great work!

readBy.name: Wirral University Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great doctors but rude reception staff
body: I've been with the practice for over 10 years now. All the doctors I've met so far have been amazing - very kind and attentive. The nurses are also good at their jobs. However, it is unfortunate that the reception staff are extremely rude. I can understand that you need to be firm working in a GP practice but their phone manners are appalling and they often do not even try and listen to you. I've also witnessed them being rude to other patients in the surgery. A little kindness will probably go a long way, especially when saying no! If it weren't for how great the doctors were I would definitely not recommend and would have moved a long time ago.

title: Super speedy support
body: I spoke with the doctor within a couple of hours of emailing and got everything I needed on the same day by phone. Really helpful and efficient.

title: Excellent patient care
body: I was really nervous about having a hysteroscopy, but the nurse practitioner and the nurses were amazing and looked after me so well. The procedure was really quick and not as bad as i imagined.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Customer service
body: I feel I need to express my gratitude to all the receptionists on the front line. I appreciate everything you all do in exceptional circumstances. Whilst waiting for my appointment I observed nothing but over whelming kindness towards patients. Listening and communication skills with patients is second to none. I applaud you for your wonderful service and support that you all give to your patients. Thank you doctors too for seeing me at short notice. You are all appreciated and valued.

title: Brilliant
body: I had an infection from an insect bite, result could have been quite serious. Instant appointment with Dr Bird cured the problem with ointment and antibiotics within 7 days, great result

title: Fantastic team!
body: I attended the pain management treatment centre today for a nerve blocker injection and had to contact you to say a huge thank you; your team was brilliant! Everyone I encountered was friendly, thoughtful, knowledgeable and looked after me so well. Despite being there for a medical procedure, it really was a very pleasant experience and I am so grateful for the level of care I received today. Thank you to you all, you do an amazing, worthwhile job!!

title: Child friendly a&e
body:
My 4 year old son cut his head open a just over 3 weeks ago and we had to go to A&E to have it seen to. We were seen promptly and the friendly receptionist directed us to the children’s waiting area which my son loved with all the paintings on the walls and books to look at. We were soon seen by a nurse who took some details then the max fax doctor came and spoke to my son (who is very nervous and quite shy) and was really friendly, he was delighted as she gave him some stickers and a toy puzzle to play with and take home (little things make a 4 y olds day!). She explained the different options we had and we chose to stay and have stitches done there and then. I was really pleased with the way that everything was explained clearly and choices made very clear. Then we had to wait a while for the numbing gel to be applied then again waited for it to work, we were made comfortable , my little boy laid on the couch on me as he was nervous being on his own and the made sure that I was comfortable and reassured me as well as my son. 
Then he had the stitches done, this was all explained to my son in a way he could understand and they kindly put peppa pig on for him to watch ; and it was all very skilfully done , although my son didn’t enjoy having the stitches put in it was done in the most reassuring way possible. 
Then it was partly glued and steristrips put over the top. 
I was a bit worried about the scar as it’s just above his eyebrow, but I am pleased to say now the scab & steristrips have come off there is a really neat line of a scar. Very impressed with the handiwork of the doctor so well done !!! Thank you.
Apart from actually having the stitches put in my son enjoyed the hospital experience!!!!!  One happy mummy & little boy. Thank you again. Keep up the good work and keep smiling.

title: Lovely friendly practice
body: I’ve used this practice for 46 years never had any problem friendly helpful staff allway help with all query’s doctors and nurses don’t there best to make you feel comfortable and at ease even in the most difficult settings

title: Highly efficient AND compassionate
body:
I called 111 tonight for very painful cystitis and extreme concern it might have an effect on my transplanted kidney and pancreas.

The team were so kind, efficient, friendly and so reassuring. The questions they asked were personal but never invasive or embarrassing. 

Within an hour of calling and a couple of very rapid call backs, I had a prescription sent to a local 24 hour pharmacy. I am now at home again with the correct tablets and feeling much less worried and a little better. 

In this time of global pandemic, how is such service possible?! How fortunate am I and are we!

Thank you so much 111 Team for being so awesomely kind and efficient!

title: Absolutely outstanding  patient care
body:
I had my ACDF operation last Wednesday 8/7/2020 and the care I received was 
fantastic from arrival to discharge .The hospital is very well organised with safety measures in place and the new patient entrance,The care in Ambulatory care being excellent  credit to all the lovely staff and  theatre porters ,I felt very at ease and comfortable on arrival to theatres  as all staff were supportive ,caring and smiling making it a much better patient experience for myself as I  had  started to feel a little nervous ,On arrival to Ward 728 I was given a lovely side room and every member of staff i met during my short overnight stay from  cleaners,healthcare assistants ,ward sisters and physiotherapist and surgeons  were all wonderful,kind and caring going above and beyond there job role nothing being too much trouble . Thank you also to my neurosurgeon and Team you truely  are fantastic professionals ensuring my operation went ahead safely and successfully .  The hospital is spotlessly clean  in a safe environment and the hospital food was delicious ,I myself work for the NHS and therefore realise how hard all staff work with the patients care being   there main priority,well done all staff at QE and thank you all so much  for such a lovely caring patient experience and for ensuring I received the best care and such a pleasant stay .

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

author: Siakn78
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Therapy input
body: Visit by therapy team after Husband had been having falls at home. Equipment provided and assistance  by Janet Physiotherapist to help with mobility and to reduce falls. Everything was very helpful, I would recommend to family and friends.

author: Sue S
title: Excellent Customer Care
body:
My Dad received an appointment to attend for his 6 monthly bone injection. However, due to the current coronavirus pandemic we felt it would be too risky for Dad to attend as he is nearly 90, very vulnerable & has been shielding.  
I therefore rang the Appointments Office & spoke to Tanya. I explained the situation & asked Tanya to cancel the appointment but Tanya said rather than do that she would get in touch with Dad's Rheumatology Nurse & ask her to give me a ring. Kirsty rang me back within 15 minutes & we had a chat about Dad & his future treatment. I feel that Tanya showed excellent Customer Care, she was very professional, courteous & helpful & could have simply cancelled the appointment at my request but she went the extra mile & should be commended for this, also Kirsty who rang me back so promptly with advice & who always gives a high standard of patient care.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

author: runningsarah
title: failure to refer me on to orthopaedic department
body:
I attended Urology clinic back in August 2019, and at the time I informed the Dr that I was getting worsening numbness in left foot, coupled with worsening incontinence. At the time they have also been aware of my previous spinal surgery on the L4/5 disc, and previous spinal related history.  
My last surgery was at Gatwick Park Hospital just over 3 years ago, when the numbness in the foot improved considerably post op and the incontinence was to a large extent resolved, However in the past 4 months the numbness in the left foot and incontinence have become very challenging to manage, and since my appointment last August, nothing appears to have happened re spinal review/referral.  
I would be very grateful if this could be rectified with either a further review either virtually/face to face asap. I am finding the increasing incontinence very humiliating, and challenging at times.

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Scotty56
title: Care for my husband.
body:
My husband who has Alzheimer's became ill and the GP was called and did a house call. The doctor examined my husband and thought he had an infection. She then said she was going to inform Hospital at Home and that a doctor and nurse would come out and assess my husband. They arrived in the afternoon and after assessing my husband, antibiotics were prescribed and a care plan put in place. The nurses were to come the next morning to see how things were and to give advice where necessary.  
I was very pleased with the service and my mind was put at rest as my husband didn't need to be admitted to hospital.  
I'm glad that this service is available.The nurses were very helpful.  
My husband became ill on Monday and was discharged back to the GP Friday.

title: Poor Service
body: I went into heartlands having suffering symptoms of potential heart attack. I waited almost 3 hours to be checked. The doctor came and explained everything and took my bloods for testing. 5 minutes later another doctor came and told me that I shouldn’t be coming in unless it’s an emergency. This hospital is for people who are in death situation not for people like me who clearly is concerned about my health and waited 3hrs until 2am. If it wasn’t serious why would I wait this long. I didn’t want to cause an argument so I spoke to the initial doctor who somehow got my blood results within 10 minutes and told me all is well I’m discharged. This is so pathetic and ridiculous. The behaviour, service and the way they made me feel. I’m confident they lied to me about my blood test. I will be following up with my local GP. Please don’t go to this hospital. Why work in public health services if you can’t deal with patients. You spend all your life time studying to become a doctor and not help people.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

author: memememe
title: Mixed experience of care
body:
Almost at lock down for covid-19 I rushed into a drop in at the sexual health clinic at Gatehouse, Ayr, to have my coil removed as I was looking to try and concieve. I had my son with me alseep in his car seat.  
I was met at the reception by two members of staff. One was so unpleasant, they almost barked at me that the clinic was now only seeing emergencies and that I could not have the coil removed, and that I also would need someone to look after my son. The other staff member certainly was not as unpleasant, but did reiterate it was emergencies only. I burst in to tears in the waiting room, where there were other people in the waiting room listening to me, so much so 1 of the women in the waiting room said, I can sit with your baby. I was overcome with all of this and fortunately a member of staff came out to get a drink and seen me. They instantly ushered me through the doors into their room. They were so kind to me, sat me down, let me cry and then asked how they could help me. I was so relieved as I was now concerned I was being judged by the other staff members.  
I asked them if I could have my coil removed, I explained my gp had cancelled my appointment, and all I could think of was that maybe this will be my last chance to have another baby.  
They smiled and said yes they could take my coil out, they did discuss with me though if I was sure that now was the right time to try to have another baby considering we were about to enter this awful pandemic. I really appreciated this, as I felt they were listening to me and taking into account my choices.  
They removed my coil, also checked I was up to date with my smears, and had no problem with my baby being in the room.  
It's always easy to critisize health services, however it can already be daunting going into any clinical environment without hostile staff, and I would use the word hostile. The care I recieved was extremley profesional, and the member of staff was really caring and compassionate to me, but leaving the clinic I felt embarassed as I had to go by the same 2 members of staff again at the front desk, and it would certainly put me off going back to that particular clinic.

title: Disjointed and rushed
body: Had a colonoscopy. Found it all to be very impersonal and a conveyor belt type operation. Only met and got to speak to the consultant doing the procedure when In theatre. Totally impersonal and quite frightening. Also when I rang the information numbers provided hardly anyone ever answered the phone.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Home visit for my dad
body: We did initially have problems getting through to get a home visit from the GP for my elderly and rather frail dad but when we did the service he received was excellent. A doctor came round the next day and they made sure it was a doctor he knew and she was excellent really good with him and he got the advice he needed.  Thank you Hurley.

title: Terrible practice
body: Rude staff members, that’s both receptionists and GPs even before coronavirus began. They have no empathy for people who aren’t getting the help the so desperately need. You get taken off their list for complaining that you are suffering because they can’t deal with you. Advoid this doctors surgery, I’ve seen so many people walk out of there in tears.

title: Unhelpful Reception Staff
body: Poor attitude from some of the reception staff.  This is mainly due to an unhelpful manner and a lack of concern when requests/problems occur.  Frequent issues with prescriptions also.

title: Appointment, you live in hope.
body: Made an appointment 3 weeks ago to speak to a doctor at 0940 on the14th, waited an hour no call. Contacted the surgery no recorded of the appointment on the system. Unfortunately this kind of service is becoming the norm. And this surgery does not want patients to attend, phone consulting only, this system only works if the surgery does the basics i.e. Record the appointments on there data base.

title: Amazing hospital
body:
I have just been discharged from the hospital after being admitted for emergency surgery.
From my arrival at the hospital, my treatment at A&E, subsequent transfer to Ward 2, surgery within around 18 hours of first arrival, post operative care on Ward 27 - the standard of care was of the highest professional standard and always delivered in a caring manner.
I cannot find the words to properly express my deepest thanks to all the amazing people who constitute what represent the QE

title: Fantastic care
body: Watford house has cared for my grandmother for a year and they are incredible- they ensure that all residents have the highest level of care and all staff are incredible

title: Wonderful Treatment
body: I have just spent 2 nights on ward 23 because of an infection The care I received was excellent and each member of staff deserves a very big thank you from me. I was there because of a minor infection which was soon cured. Everyone was so cheerful, very efficient and very caring. Nothing was too much trouble. Having had to miss my scheduled drip one member went out of her way to reschedule so that I was able to go on a holiday that I’d been waiting since March to go on to see family. While not a place any of us choose to visit, when it’s necessary you can be sure of the kindest, most caring and most important, efficient treatment. Thank you very much all of you.

readBy.name: Shrewsbury and Telford Hospital NHS Trust

author: Hoggie
title: I was treated with respect.
body: I was admitted to basildon hospital with a heart attack, from A/E to the wards care could not have been better, AMU East was brilliant, But what can I say about James Mackenzie Ward I was treated with respect and was told everything that was going on with my treatment, and the nurses, and all the staff and Doctors were amazing, Thank you to you all. You are amazing.

readBy.name: Basildon and Thurrock University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: GREAT SERVICE
body:
I had  a cataract operation 2 days ago and justed wanted to thank all concerned in Pickering ward for their kindness, efficiency and clinical skill. From the consultant/surgeon down everyone was helpful, supportive and knowledgeable.
Thank you all!!

title: A positive experience
body: I had an elective caesarean and everything about the experience was excellent. I was apprehensive due to restrictions on partners being able to visit, but the ward staff were really kind and understanding of the situation. The surgical team were brilliant and made the operation itself calm and cheerful as the circumstances allowed! If you’re due to give birth here during the pandemic, you’ll be in safe hands. Thank you.

title: Odd attitude
body: Receptionists helpful. Got an appointment quickly. Impressive during these times. Dr was cold and indifferent. Wouldn’t prescribe painkillers. Was clipped and interrupted me. Told me to hurry up. I’m not going to see this Dr ever again.

title: Excellent Service
body: Always really happy to help and they always make sure I get the medication I need on time.  Both the doctors and staff make this practice an excellent one.

title: Great practice
body: Just finished via phone a 6 weeks course,I have improved so much and now have stopped taking one of my medication I have been taking for a while and that is excellent imformation and good advice I was given ,which I followed and it worked for me.A massive thanks to the team I would advise anybody to give it a try ,I am glad I signed up for it ,it has been life changing for me

title: Amazing support
body: Really friendly, understanding and take everything about your circumstances into consideration. Very polite, give amazing support and advice. Kept in contact regularly and updated/informed about appointments and next steps. Highly recommend to family and friends if struggling with mental illness and need support or just need someone unrelated to speak to.

readBy.name: Dorset HealthCare University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic Care
body: All staff were amazing and provided excellent care during my stay The one to one care was a real help after my operation Big thankyou to all You do a brilliant job

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic service in adverse conditions.
body: During this period of Covid19 I have had some health issues, which nessecitated phone consultations; blood tests and prescription/ medication collections. Throughout the whole time, I have been given the best of care and assistance by all the staff at the Uppingham practice. The receptionists, support staff, nurses, pharmacy staff and doctors have all been amazing. Service, although different, has been prompt, thoughtful and supportive. Many thanks to you all!

title: Shocking lack of care
body:
My mother was admitted to ward E1 and the level of care and attention was appalling to say the least. Ward was understaffed and quality of care resulted in a safeguarding notification being raised through social services and hospital team. Only saving factor is that the escalation to a senior manager resulted in change of ward where the level of care was significantly improved.

The treatment of my mother on the ward by certain members of staff was substantially below what would be reasonably expected by a care professional and this needs to be addressed by the hospital management team who have been made aware of the concerns and facts.

title: Rude reception staff but physio staff was lovely
body:
I visited the emergency care unit for a knee injury on 14/7/2020
The lady on the reception desk was so rude to visitors and I even witnessed her bring one visitor to tears, She asked me why I decided to visit the unit and when I told her she tutted and was shaking her head. 

I understand we are still going through a pandemic and it’s worrying time for everyone, people wasn’t even getting in the door properly and she was shouting ‘sanitizer your hands’. I think she needs some training in customer care. We have to social distance but the staff stood around like it was a get together. 

The physio  I saw for my injury was absolutely brilliant and had time for me and actually asked if I had any questions which I haven’t experienced before when visiting the hospital.

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Exceptional care at the RSCH
body: My son broken his arm, needed surgery at the time and then again a week later. In the last two weeks we have dealt with the Royal Surrey County Hospital A&E, oncall orthopaedics, outpatient orthopaedics, anaesthetic and theatre teams, and two stays on the children’s ward (Hascombe). I genuinely cannot fault the care we have had from every single person. Yes there is some waiting about and it isn’t always the most efficient but this is a massive organisation with so many different components. The staff on Hascombe Children’s ward were exceptional - caring, friendly and yet professional. They communicated brilliantly throughout and that makes such a difference to the experience. It was also great to see some really proactive teaching going on with student nurses and doctors. We see so many criticisms of NHS and it is so easy to complain, I just had to take a moment to say thank you and share my positive story.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very good service
body:
Been at this practice for 3 years now was very nervous about leaving my old practice but had moved out of the area. This practice is very accommodating. The re-prescription service is second to none & easy done via email and then taken to the pharmacy ready for collection.

The Dr there who see's both me and my partner (mainly) is simply amazing he always makes time for us and re-assures us he's very kind and has abundance of empathy.

Thank you for all you do at the practice (and that's everyone!)

title: Outstanding
body:
In the 11 years as patients with this practice there has not been one occasion we can fault the service.
Despite the current Covid 19 pandemic their service has been exemplary in every aspect.
Given the historical national shortage of GP’s Whiteley Surgery has always provided on time appointments and treatment as well as referrals.
We cannot express our thanks and gratitude to the staff and doctors who have gone beyond their duty to assist, which is in total variance to some negative social media complaints we have seen.
Our experience has been outstanding.

title: X ray Department
body: Staff friendly. Clean and tidy. Very short wait but that may have been due to lack of patients due to Covid 19 pandemic

title: Video consultation
body:
I had a video consultation today for the first timewith my Gp practice, I found the experience very good I spoke with a doctor who specialised with my problem and was very good in how to deal with it, and sent me information on different exercises I needed to do.
I phoned to speak to a doctor yesterday afternoon and they said some one will phone me this morning and they did. No matter what time of day you phone goldenhill practise you can always make an appointment to some on to phone you back, you don't have to keep phoning each morning for availability like in other practices.

title: Poor customer service
body: MY PARTNER called and asked for a callback the doctor on the phone was really rude he needs some more training on how to speak with vulnerable people speaking about medication and all he could say is "I can up the dose and there's nothing else I can do" a doctor was supposed to be talking to her before being prescribed the medication again in the first place as the conversation went on he also replies "the medication won't be working anyway because it's a small dose for your size" basically saying she's overweight why not just say what he really wants to say? my partner came of the phone crying because the surgery staff are rude and don't wanna help he didn't know what to do or say he shouldn't be working there

title: Balmoral Eye Clinic
body: A pleasure to be there. A complete contrast to Windsor which is a dehumanising experience to say the least. I would go back to Balmoral tomorrow. I would rather chew my own arm off than return to Windsor.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Waiting for a response
body: Since having both my legs amputated I have been increasingly incontinent.I have completed a continence assessment several months ago and submitted it to the Hersden office.  Since then I have heard nothing but I continue to soil my clothing and bedding.

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Awful uncaring receptionist
body: This surgery is awful and has got worse over the years. Whenever you ring there is a loop of selecting options and can only contact anyone between certain times to make appointments.  So you phone at those times to be told no appointments left for the morning slots phone back later, you phone back later to be told the same thing.  So you ask for a routine appointment to be told there aren't any.  The receptionists spend their whole time gossiping rather than caring about their patients, they are rude uncaring and seem to be thinking about anything except their work.  This practice needs an overhaul

title: didn’t feel welcome, wasn’t treated like a human…
body: As soon as I arrived at the Romford clinic the first encounter that I had was with the receptionists who were extremely rude. I was then told to wait in the waiting area and I finally got called in by the the nurse 20 minutes later than what I had scheduled. The nurse came across very intimidating and cold, almost as if she wasn’t in a good mood. I was having a medical abortion so she was explaining the process to me but It was completely rushed and unorganised. Unfortunately her presence was not friendly at all, and as you can imagine I was already nervous about the whole process so her demeanour made me feel more anxious. After she quickly explained everything in minutes, I  had an ultra-sound scan and after that she was then looking at the ultra sound photos in front of me, I could clearly see the photos and as you can imagine I did not want to see that during such a distressing time. I was out of there within 10 minutes. Overall, the entire experience was awful, I was not treated like a human being, I felt disrespected and not cared for. I would never go back to this clinic and would not recommend unless you have thick skin. I hope the Romford clinic can take this onboard and treat their future patients with more kindness, patience and respect as this can really take a toll on someone mentally. I still feel sad about the whole experience to this day.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: First rate service from Berkeley Place Surgery…
body:
I recently developed a skin condition that was not improving and decided to contact BPS, using their online consultation app - eConsult - and was hugely impressed. 

I completed the form and received an immediate, automatic confirmation of receipt, followed soon after by a telephone call from a member of the clinical team offering me a face-to-face appointment later that afternoon. I was subsequently very gratefu and relieved to receive a quick and reassuring diagnosis, together with signposting to resources for further information, and a referral to the local Dermatology Department.

So, in litle more than two hours, I was on my way home reflecting that, despite the current difficult times we experience, BPS continues to provide and develop a first rate service to patients.

Thank you!

title: Excellent Urology Department
body: I recently had a  cystoscopy to carry out a bladder inspection. The whole experience, from being received to being discharged was excellent. The procedure itself took only around twenty minutes and I did not experience any discomfort or pain. I was able to watch the procedure on a computer screen as it was being carried out and everything was explained to me throughout. Afterward, the surgeon in charge of the urology team discussed the results with me and told me what follow up treatment was required. All in all, a very interesting and informative experience. To any men reading this and are about to have a cystoscopy, or if you need one in the future, do not hesitate, it is a simple straight forward procedure carried out with kindness, care and respect in Airedale's wonderful urology department.

title: thank you staff and team
body: thank you for your care, doctors were very helpful , chaperon offered ,  I will recommend to others , staff was helpful as well, they all organised same day blood test for  me

title: Really hardworking reception  staff
body: I have been registered at this practice for over 30 years and  in that time I have never ever had an issue or problem with any of the reception staff or any of the doctors or practice nurses.   In  fact in my experience the reception staff go out of their way to try and accommodate you   Yes , when I was working it could be difficult  to get through on the telephone but the system has recently been upgraded and in my experience it is brilliant!  It is an extremely busy practice and I think that during the recent pandemic the reception staff have really come into their own . They have been extremely pleasant and helpful on the telephone.   I think the practice has always offered as many different ways of contacting a GP or nurse as they  possibly can.   The new telephone system looks very promising and I do hope that the practice also keeps the Econsult   service,  it's so much easier ordering repeat prescriptions or asking advice from a GP or a nurse.   I have used this service and number of times during lockdown  and a GP has always got back to me , usually within 24-hours.   I accept that this service wouldn't be easy to use for someone who's not familiar with completing online forms but I think the new telephone triage system is going to  help there as well.   To sum up I have always been very satisfied with the care I have received this practice and I don't see any reason why the switch change in the future

title: Amazing care
body: I spent 3/4 days in Critical Care unit after my operation on the 3rd july, the doctors, nurses, and all other staff were extremely caring and loving in the work they do, I wouldn't be here now if it wasnt for them, 24/7 service unbelievable I can not thank these people enough, they so deserve alot more than there credit for. Thank you all for your help in getting me on the mend, I cant thank you enough,you all deserve Gold medals in my eyes.

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Made to feel like an inconvenience
body: Going through a miscarriage, never told the results on time, when calling up to ask for results, made to feel like an inconvenience for daring to ask - I know the nhs is busy but I also work in healthcare and know the importance of giving upsetting results on time. No one at any point has checked my physical and mental health and it seems like I’m just a number rather than a patient.

title: Brilliant service!
body: I phoned the surgery in a bit of a panic because I was advised by the walk in center that nobody would have me get my implant replaced due to covid. The manager answered the phone, calmed me down and went out of her way to get me an appointment somewhere that would be able to preform the surgery. Thank you so much for your help.

title: Wednesday plt during the pandemic
body:
I was advised that surgeries would stay openEd even during Wednesdays when surgeries are shut for protective learning training ? 

I seem to always phone on a Wednesday even when I was advised by receptionists to phone but their phone lines are shut 

I end up phoning 111 who then phone the surgery to open up their phone lines ? 

Please can this be clarified on the website wether or not you are opened during the pandemic and not having plt?

author: Wispy 5
title: Stopping smoking with quit your way (Hamilton team glasgow)
body:
I was told of this group by my brother who had been in the QEUH in Glasgow with a diabetic problem, QUIT YOUR WAY they approach him helped him and he is now a non smoker. My brother gave me the number of this group and I telephoned them but because I live in East Kilbride I was not in their catchment but they told me they would look at the group who would help me and that they would telephone me back, they did.  
Hamilton Group, it was a girl called Kate that got in touch with me and helped me through this, gave me loads of encouragement , with this lockdown I didn't think I would do this but I honestly think that Kate has ESP as every time I struggled badly I would get a call from Kate she was always very cheerful in her manner giving me support and encouraging me to keep going. I have not had a cigarette for 42 days and I feel great but I know that without all the help and encouragement from Kate and the girls that delivered the patches to my door evey two weeks I may have had a relapse.  
The group QUIT YOUR WAY are a terrific group and I can't thank this group and their staff enough

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: The NHS is Wonderful
title: Tumour Removal Surgery
body:
A tumour was discovered in the lower part of my parotid gland following a scan just before the Covid19 outbreak. Following this, between April and June, I had 2 biopsies of the area. Both visits to hospital were daunting experiences in the midst of the Covid pandemic.  
Following the results of the biopsies I met my surgeon Dr. Gurunathan (Consultant Head,Neck and ENT Surgeon) and his assistant Laura in Daisy Hill. This was an extremely worrying and confusing time for my family and I but I was much more relaxed after meeting Dr. Gurunathan and his team who explained the process and procedures to me in great detail.  
Within 24 hours I received a call personally from Dr. Gurunathan to confirm that my operation would be in 7-days time. He again explained to me the procedure and allowed me the opportunity to ask any questions or raise any concerns. He put my mind at rest and also kindly contacted my wife to assure her and speak directly to her. This personal touch at such a busy time for the NHS was most welcome and this attention to detail left us confident that I was in the safest possible hands.  
I was admitted to Craigavon Area Hospital to have the tumour removed from my parotid gland. While I was naturally frightened by the whole process I must say that I will be forever grateful to the many staff of Craigavon Area Hospital who cared for and looked after my every need. Due to the pandemic I was admitted to the maternity ward of the Craigavon Area Hospital where each and every member of staff were fantastic and made me very relaxed and comfortable. There were too many staff to mention or even recall their names but I do hope that this message of thanks is relayed to them all.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: MyNameIsMatt
title: All thanks to the amazing work by the Orthodontic department
body:
Ever since I was little I was always bullied for the way I looked due to having a severe under bite.  
When I first went to the hospital I was at around the age of 14 I was told I was looking at around 6 or so years for me to get the surgery I desperately wanted as my jaw was still growing, as sad as that made me I pushed through the bullying and started treatment with the clinic.  
Every single person at Good Hope Hospitals orthodontic department was incredibly nice and treated me very well, the closer I got to the surgery the better I felt about my appearance and my mental health was improving as well.  
When I was around 18-19 I had a particularly bad experience on the bus home from college where a group of girls were laughing at and taking pictures of me, after years of similar experiences with bullying this was the straw the broke the camels back and I went home crying it'd gotten to the point where I was scared to go outside. I never interacted with anyone person to person and my mental health was probably at its lowest point and I wanted to just not "exist" anymore.  
At this point it would have been another 1-2 years until the surgery was likely to occur and I was seriously depressed, after the episode on the bus I vented my frustrations to the team at the orthodontics department and they were incredibly sympathetic.  
Dr Panesar arranged a telephone call with a previous patient who had gone through the same ordeal as me in order to help me connect with other people in my situation. Dr Panesar at this point suggested an experimental treatment that could bring the surgery forward by a few years and then they would perform the bracework after instead of before surgery.  
I immediately was ecstatic to hear that this was a potential possibility and said I wanted it if it was possible, later on the department had arranged a meeting with the surgeon who would be performing the procedure and he and Dr. P talked me through everything that the surgery entailed and if I was still willing to do it and I proceeded with the surgery, when the day finally came around I was put to sleep and woke up with an entirely new face, needless to say I cried tears of joy that day as everything that had affected me my entire life and kept me up at night was gone, after years of hating myself and my appearance.  
It took a while built I was actually able to the thing I heard about my whole life called "Confidence" within a year of the surgery I went from failing classes and sitting at home to getting the highest grades possible, my first Job alongside my studies and a girlfriend.  
I've never been so happy in my entire life and it is all thanks to the amazing work performed by the Orthodontics department at Good Hope Hospital and the amazing surgeon Mr Williams. I owe them everything. Thank you, for everything.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

author: CFK94
title: Crohn’s treatment
body:
The level of care I receive is excellent. All the nurses are friendly and very capable. Nothing is too much to ask them and they make my stay very comfortable and as relaxing as possible. They’re brilliant.  
My only recommendation would be to see if it possible to run clinics in Dungannon hospitals long term, instead of just for a short while during the COVID19 pandemic as Dungannon is much closer and a lot handier for me to access.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Maskless
title: wearing mandatory face masks
body: On visiting the hospital yesterday for an appointment, I was initially pleased to meet the staff checking that everyone entering was wearing a face mask. Unfortunately, I was shocked to see all members of staff visiting the shop AND the shop assistant NOT using masks. If masks are mandatory for everyone why are the people in the shop exempt. I think this is very poor practice in a hospital and not a very good example.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

links.id: staff and employees in the shop wear face masks

author: A None Mouse
title: The rapid decline of my experiences at this hospital
body:
With Crawley Hospital now just a shadowy unused shell of its former past, East Surry now remains my only option for secondary health care. 5 years ago my daughter was born there and I couldn't fault a single thing.... oh how times have changed.  
My last three experiences of the care received at the hospital have been nothing short of disgusting and I think the nursing team on the Brokham ward should be absolutely ashamed to call them selfs health care professionals. Apart from one nurse who has been lovely, its a shame the rest of that team can't be lead by their example in terms of compassion and empathy.  
18 months ago I was taken to A&E with unbearable abdominal pain. I could barely walk and was prone to passing out and stumbling for the pain. I sat unconscious  
in the waiting room for two hours without a care. we were called in, a quick exam in A&E and was then told to go to the acute medic ward and wait for a surgeon. I left after three days of waiting (sent home and told t come back each day). 4 days later I was in Scotland for work, 1 day later I was in a Scottish emergency surgery room having my ruptured appendix removed.  
November last year I was there as next of kin to my partner but I won't discuss their treatment on here as its very personal.  
Now, July, as we speak, my partner is currently laying in a bed in the Brokham ward, waiting for emergency surgery, having been kept off any oral food or water for 4 days now, and we sit eagerly awaiting the news that their emergency appointment will be cancelled as the surgeon has finished for the day and the on call team are being kept free for 'Actual Emergencies" which is word for word how we have just been spoken to by the nurse on shift.  
So as we draw to a close on day 5, no food or drink until the very last moment. I direct this story directly the Board of Directors of the SAHS NHS Trust.  
And for the record, we are not an isolated case. I have seen the patients on this ward feel forgotten, abandoned and safe to say all seem to be in a great deal of physical and mental pain.  
My partner is going to self discharge as we write this. And if anything happens to her as a result of her non existent care, I will be holding those responsible to account.

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

author: Trabea
title: Trying to get my elderly mother discharged
body:
My mother was admitted to hospital to have an operation to remove cancer. It was totally successful. She’s been confused for a couple of years and we were told that this could be due to her medication or the cancer.  
After her operation she was declared fit and well by her doctor but the discharge liaison nurse told me that my mother had had a diagnosis of dementia two years ago. Now they won’t let her come home. My father was her full time cater until recently.  
During lockdown due to the Covid 19, they were shielding and we would call and drop off shopping but weren’t really that involved as my dad has always done a wonderful job of caring for her and she is still doing a lot for herself. She was due to go into hospital to have the cancer removed and we were all very nervous. On the morning she refused to go. My dad called me at six in the morning but I was asleep. I woke at half six and called him back on his mobile. No answer. I called the house phone and my mother said he’d gone back to bed. I went straight to their house. He’d taken an overdose.  
He was taken to hospital and thankfully made a full recovery. He said he was just frustrated that he couldn’t get her ready for such an important occasion and that despite numerous hospital appointments, tests and scans we were no nearer finding out why she was acting so strangely. We were told she didn’t have dementia. He’s very ashamed of what he did.  
The hospital released him and I spoke with them and they said they believed that it was due to being isolated during lockdown and the frustration at no diagnosis for my mother. Now the hospital have said she was diagnosed in 2018. I have all the correspondence from the hospitals and there is no mention of a dementia diagnosis. They are keeping her in hospital and whilst I can’t fault the medical care they are giving her, her mental health is really suffering. We want her home and she is desperate to be home. She’s in a room on her own due to covid, there’s no windows and she just sits in a chair all day. I feel she would benefit by being home, I’ve said that my sister and I will support my dad with all aspects of her care but they want her to go to an assessment unit. She calls me several times a day and is distraught. She just wants to come home and we want her back. I understand that we will need outside support and we will jump through hoops to get her home. There’s nothing physically wrong with her now and she has been discharged by her doctor. However, she’s still languishing in that hospital room. She thinks she’s done something wrong and that she’s in her prison. It’s breaking our hearts. What can we do. I fear for her mental health and my father’s. What can we do?

author: Zebbie
title: My journey with lock down and drinking
body:
My journey with lock down and drinking more than I wanted too during lock down  
Drinking more than usual because of lock down made me realize that I needed a bit of help but felt a little nervous to reach out for help until I thought how much easier it would be than trying to cut back or stop on my own.  
I would like to thank everyone one that has helped me through this journey, for all their support, kindness, encouragement and for never judging me. I am now on day six of my detox and feel so much Like my old self again, no more awful hang overs. I feel so much more positive and motivated. I feel alive again and healthy.  
I recommend this service and would especially like to thank the lovely nurse Janice, my support worker Daniella for all there kindnesses and amazing work. I feel blessed. On wards and upwards now for me.. never give up and seek help if you feel you need it.. It could be the best thing you ever do for your self and loved one's.

author: Finally Mum
title: Overall I've had a fantastic level of care
body:
I recently gave birth to my first baby at Wishaw General Hospital. My maternity care has been provided under the community midwife programme "Best Start. I cannot fault the care I have received throughout my pregnancy from my assigned Midwife. My midwife has been a consistent source of support throughout, making me feel comfortable & at ease from the very first appointment, offered valuable advice and kept me very well informed throughout. In light on the current Covid situation, I felt fearful & concerned through the later stages of my pregnancy, my midwife kept in regular contact, reassuring me & keeping me well informed of any changes etc. The one to one midwife care I received has without a doubt made my pregnancy experience a more positive one especially in the correct situation.  
However, when labour started it was confirmed at my routine midwife appointment that day. When things progressed I made contact with the "on call" midwife who was already at a delivery with another patient. After being advised to contact maternity triage directly, I did so expecting to be greeted with the same compassion & understanding as I had with the community team. That wasn't the case, I was questioned regarding what level my pain was at, to be told throughout the telephone conversation I didn't sound like I'd had any pain or even contractions. Which was not the case. I felt I wasn't being taken seriously and was belittled. Being advised that it's was my first bay, things would be slow, if I came in my partner would be sent away etc. I was shocked, at my most vulnerable I expected to be taken seriously and be treated with some compassion. It was later confirmed that I was in fact ready for hospital and in early stages of labour. I felt nervous arriving at the ward due to the uncomfortable & unpleasant manner I was greeted with when calling. However, that was not the case. My experience with the team was fantastic, the assigned midwife was lovely & took great care of me until the "Best Start" on call midwife took over, who just happened to be my own midwife.  
Overall I've had a fantastic level of care provided, especially my midwife but I do feel the admission to hospital was upsetting and an experience that could have been avoided.

author: L1234
title: Fantastic consultant
body: My Daughter has been under the care of Mr kilpatrick ( hand specialist at Glasgow’s children’s hospital) since she was a baby. She was discharged this week as her care is now complete. I just wanted to highlight how wonderful and supportive he has been to us as a family over the past 15 years, he is kind, caring and always professional. Thanks so much for making a difficult time so much easier throughout her appointments, operations and procedures. We never felt forced to do anything we didn’t want to and always had full explanations provided and that is vital to reassure anxious parents. Thanks again

author: Cleocatra
title: 98 year old mum ultrasound appointment.
body:
My mum is 98 and partially sighted and unable to walk. She had an appointment on Sunday for an ultrasound on Clarendon wing. The postcode on the Appointment letter is for George Street and so my sat nav took me there. There is only a staff car park there and where we needed to be was a 5- 10 minute walk away.  
A porter was in the car park just going to start his break. He directed me to the car park I needed to drive to and decided he would come in the car with me, guided me there, got a chair for my mum and pushed her along to the ultra sound department - all whilst he should have been on his break. His name was Paul and I just want to thank him for his kindness and patience shown to me and my mum. This was excellent service going beyond expectations. Many thanks.

author: Vasanti
title: All my treatment i have had
body:
I have been getting treatment for the. last 6 years my treatment is coming to a end I want to say a massive thankyou to miss tansley and karen who have looked after me I could not have asked for star quality they are fantastic  
I could not have got through my cancer treatment without them thank you from the bottom of my heart I live life to the full holidays and am back working in my job thank you to all the other nurses and doctors who have looked after me on my journey im cancer free xxx

author: doradojj46
title: They do the NHS proud
body:
I gave birth to my son at East Surrey Hospital. My son wouldn't feed and was vomiting and he ended up at Neonatal Care.  
From my induction through to my discharge staff have been so kind, proactive and professional. They do the NHS proud. My five day stay was as comfortable as possible and I would recommend it to any mother.

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

author: Bill 1
title: Broken Hip
body:
Taken by ambulance to wishaw general after falling and breaking my hip.  
After A&E was taken to ward 12 prepared for surgery and had heart attack on operating table and opperation was cancelled. next couple days in ward 12 before being transferred to ward 14 where i was very well looked after by Rachel, Marta and all the nurses . Unfortunately I can't remember all the name's wish I could name every one of them.  
Last ward transferred to was 17 where very good care was given especially by Betty, Larissa, Kirsten, but really all the nurses are fantastic very caring and pleasant. Personally I think they are over worked and under paid and not appreciated enough. I was confined to bed for a month as after having heart attack was moved to Hairmyres to have stents inserted so have to wait till heart has recovered before hip operation can be considered again.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: Hymooth Mighty Horse
title: 3rd wee one
body: Thank you so much once again for all the care and professional support to my wife and I during the birth of our son. We have delivered two daughters at the hospital and the experience has always been fantastic.

title: Thank you
body: I was having persistent diarrhoea for some weeks, and starting to panic that I couldn't eat anything without an episode, but the doctors were very reassuring and supportive and helped a lot. Thank you to them all for their help!

title: Excellent Care
body:
I was 'lucky' enough to have a prolapse operation on the 7th July at the West Cumberland Hospital.
The care, friendliness of all the staff before, during and after my surgery was exemplary.
I was informed at every stage what was happening.
Their kindness and general attitude was reassuring during my short stay of 2 nights. 
You are very lucky to have such wonderful staff.
Can you thank them all?

readBy.name: North Cumbria Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good service from receptionist
body: I felt I wanted to leave this review because I happened to call to discuss a referral that I wanted clarity on. I was adamant I didn't want to take up a doctor's appointment over the telephone with this query. I felt this receptionist communicated really well and fully resolved my enquiry, I'm explaining as much as she could to me so that I knew exactly where things stood. She was extremely patient and could understand my concern.  What I had been trying to avoid was ,further down the line, a potentially wasted appointment in these times of demand on the NHS. I also didn't want to take up the time of a nurse or a doctor if it could be sorted out at the point of reception. Thank you very much.

title: Great minor treatment centre
body: Took my granddaughter there for a possible broken wrist. Service and staff absolutely charming and very polite. Granddaughter was happy with the care she received from all members of the team. Would definitely go there again

title: Great service
body: Thank you so much to the male healthcare assistant who fitted me in this morning when the nurse I was booked in with struggled to find a vein. You are an asset to forest house surgery and are always kind and friendly. You are also brilliant with my dad who has difficult veins because he is under chemo. I asked a couple of questions and you was compassionate and very knowledgeable. Also a big thanks to the receptionists who are as friendly and as nice as ever. Also a big thanks to all the doctors and all the staff who are continually giving exceptional service.

title: Amazing staff
body: I was in hospital for a week, after my surgery I was looked after by all staff, even in the departure lounge these ladie were unbelievable, it wasnt a case at all just sitting waiting for your pick, these ladies went out there way to sit n chat with you making you feel comfortable, offering drinks helping you in any way they could, they want just sitting behind the desk and leaving you to it, like other hospitals, like I said they came out of there way noticing they were patients there they were amazing can not thank this hospital enough, from the beginning of my surgery right through the end of departures I was noticed, looked after and cared for thank you  all very much

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: wonderfull expiriens
body: had cateract removed 3 days ago at eccleshill bradford. front desk staff through to theatre staff five star service . all conditions due to covid 19 in place , wonderfull expirience  can recomend anybody wanting cateract surgery to use SpaMedica a big thankyou  to all the staff at Bradford will se you soon for secod Eye doing .

title: Delayed electronic refferal letter  to the…
body: Very disappointed experience, GP delayed electronic refferal letter to the hospital,despite of the fact that he said he would do now during your telephone conversation, and I was in terrible pain.  Next day I was chasing up  with  the hospital,my electronic referral letter and I was told that is not any electronic referral letter under my name and  I called back my surgery to find out the reason and I could not find any reasonable explination, I am still waiting,unwell to be referred as soon as possible to the hospital. I am very unhappy and frustrated about all this,  do not receive medical care in time,despite my surgeon is happy ,in shortly time to see me in the clinic.

title: DISGUSTING
body: Staff not helpful.Talk down to you.Dont listen.Dont answer fone.Dont contact you back.Had to take daughter to hospital as they wouldn't help.No fone call after 3 weeks.This has nothing to do with COVID. Just damn right disgusting place. Not helpful in any way .

readBy.name: Greater Manchester Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent service
body: I was referred to the centre in Meir, Stoke on Trent on 14/7/2020 to check the sight in my left eye which has deteriorated over the last month or so. The gentleman I saw had an excellent manner and following examination of my eye he is arranging for laser treatment to remove cells remaining  from cataract surgery 6 years ago

title: Covid 19 has meant even worse service
body: My partner had blood tests at the clinic last week. Then the Dr called and told him he needed another one but they could not do it at the surgery. Understandable, but they gave him a bit of paper to organise it a the hospital but with no instructions on how to organise it! It took me an hour to find out it has to be done on line, my partner is not computer literate. I managed finally to do it for him, he is vulnerable, if this was an old lady or guy with no support, how are they meant to do it. I am also sadly registered at the practice, I am immune compromised, I have only ever had one appointment in 3 years. My hospital consultant told me the Doctors should have told me to self isolate during this period. The GPs never advised me or contacted me and I have only recently found this out! I know how difficult it is for the NHS at the moment as in my role at work I deal with hospitals across 25 countries. The service or lack of service at this GP was at best awful and at worst unacceptable. I shall be contacting the Primary Care Trust and moving from this practice as soon as possible. All anyone wants when they are not feeling well, is some support and guidance. None of this has been provided to date.

author: Fred 53
title: Prostate Cancer and PMR
body:
In February 2017 I went to the doctors with a "bad" back, I came out of the surgery with PMR (what's that? ) and prostate cancer, for which I had had no symptons what so ever.  
After a blood test the following week (PSA 42), I found myself, very frightened and nervous, in an Outpatients clinic at North Devon Hospital. Next ordeal was a biopsy, the thought of this absolutely terrified me, previously I was not too happy just having a blood sample taken, basically I am a coward when it comes to medical matters. All the staff at the biopsy were brilliant, very patient, understanding and genuinely caring. The biopsy was no where near as bad as I feared it was going to be.  
Next on the agenda, Chemotherapy! Maybe I was lucky, the only after effect I had was severe constipation, alright I did not feel brilliant for a few days after each session, but that was all. My consultant is fantastic even taking the trouble to schedule my sessions so that I would be at my best for my daughters wedding.  
All that's now history and three and a half years later, I have come to terms with the fact there is no cure for my cancer, only control, I feel better than I have for years, this I am convinced is partially down to the excellent treatment I have received in the hospital coupled with the unfailing friendiness and patience of the staff, For me the only downside of hospital appointments has been car parking! .

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: rickwriter
title: home care after leaving hospital
body:
My wife fell & fractured her hip in June. She's been battling with Alzheimers since diagnosed in 2015. Unbelievably she was back home 12 days later & then regularly visited & cared for by Home First care team for the next for two and half weeks.  
Both the hospital & care staff have been brilliant! Caring, kind, knowledgeable and making us both feel good. She had started to walk with a zimmer before she came home & 3 days ago we were getting back upstairs to our bed. Nothing was too much trouble and they all made us feel positive. Our family is all over the world & under lockdown they couldn't visit anyway. So actually we've had more contact than we would have normally!  
We're really sad to see them go, but couldn't have had better care.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Reassuring, good humoured, very efficient
body:
I was scared …….less when I went in but the ebullient quips by the doorman calmed me.
Everyone was wonderful and on the ball so much so that at one point I felt like giving them my wrong date of birth to floor them, but I didn't.
The op. was amazing, as I said at the end that the lights I saw during the op were as good as Pink Floyd's stage show.
Reassuring words from the Discharge nurse sent me on my way.
Lovely people, down to the cleaning staff, up to the operating team.

Thanks

Namaste

author: Mrs music
title: Physio intervention
body:
I fell behind my front door picking up the post, I hadn't put my pendant alarm on so I was there for half an hour with my legs trapped underneath me. I was in such pain as my Sciatic nerve was hurting and I could not get up.  
When I got back from hospital Janet the Physio came to see me. She was very kind, sorted some equipment for my arthritic knee and gave me some exercises to do when the pain started to ease. These are helping although my legs are still swollen. I was sorry I could not do more when she first came to see me but I was in too much pain.

title: Absolutely excellent practice, fantastically…
body: The staff on reception at Red House are always extremely helpful and kind. They go out of their way to be able to help, and to arrange appointments that will suit.  The practice is extremely clean, and well run: the self-check-in is great, and you know straight away if the doctor / nurse is running on time. The whole place has the real feel of a "family practice", where everyone cares about the patients. A big thank you to everyone at Red House :)

author: Anonymous53
title: Never returning to Harlow EPU again
body:
8 weeks ago I found out I was pregnant and self referred myself to my nearest hospital. A week later I was contacted and made an appointment for my 12 week scan and was told I would be contacted for my 8-10week bloods.  
Approaching week 6 I contacted the EPU as I hadn't heard about my bloods to be told to contact a week later. A week later (week 7) I was told wait longer which was frustrating.  
Unfortunately I experienced symptoms of a miscarriage a few days later . Not knowing what to do I turned to the Internet and the general advice was to attended Aand E. I was turned away and told to take painkillers for my pain and keep an eye on my bleeding. I was given a number to call for an EPU appointment which was made a few days later.  
On the day of the scan I was told I had a miscarriage and told to wait for the Dr. I waited 2.5 hours to see the Dr but had clearly been missed off the system as other patients after me had been and gone. To wait by yourself alone (due to covid) was torture. I was then told by the nurse that I wouldn't be seeing the Dr (assuming this was due to being seen so late) and was given information on miscarriage.  
The day after my scan appointment to confirm my miscarriage I was called by the midwife to arrange my bloods which I had been calling weeks before to book in to which I had to heart wrenchingly say I had miscarried.  
Before and during my miscarriage I have been experiencing pain on my right side which is constant and changes in severity when changing positions /walking /taking a deep breath. I called the EPU 1 week after my miscarriage and the midwife made me an appointment to see the Dr the same day. This brought a sigh of relief as it meant I could have my pain investigated and see the Dr to which I should have seen the week before.  
15 minutes later I was called by the Dr to cancel my appointment due to covid and told that they were cutting down appointments which were not necessary. I was told to contact in 3 weeks if the pain continued. I went on to explain the pain was present weeks prior to the miscarriage to which was dismissed. I felt the Dr was insensitive and made me feel 'stupid' for even contacting the clinic. I am aware of the global pandemic but feel like the level of care and empathy has been substandard throughout.  
Being in the medical field I am aware that empathy and understanding is needed, especially during emotional times of miscarriage. Due to my experience, If and when I become pregnant again I will be avoiding Harlow.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Consistently Good Practice
body: The clinic has always  been an important element of our general wellbeing. The doctors, nurses & reception members are always helpful, approachable, patient, pleasant to talk to. The clinic is well managed & efficient, clean, & the staff are professional  We feel very fortunate to be able to attend a clinic with these qualities.

title: Excellent practice.
body: I spoke to a Doctor at 4.15pm on the 10th July to request antibiotics which the Ulcer Clinic I attend felt I needed. A prescription was emailed to my local chemist who then delivered them to my home at 4.45pm. The Ulcer Clinic were extremely impressed with that kind of treatment and I agree with them entirely.

author: Family member123
title: Rowan 1 at Highbury hospital
body:
My dad was a patient on Rowan 1 recently. I went to visit him having arranged this with a member of staff one morning while he was there. The member of staff I spoke to informed me that I would be able to use the family room to see my dad from 16:30-17:00.  
I had not seen my dad since he had become so acutely unwell and, needless to say, was anxious to see him. The last few months have been some of the most difficult my dad, my mum and I have ever experienced; largely due to my dad becoming so unwell. I arrived at 16:30 as arranged and waited outside In the rain having pressed the buzzer for reception. No response. I then pressed the buzzer for Rowan 1, which I also got no response to. I was waiting for 8 minutes with no response which was upsetting in itself as it was eating into time with my dad.  
I would like to add at this point I am a student nurse and have 6 years experience as a health care assistant so I am certainly not oblivious to short staffing, busy wards and time constraints, however being on the receiving end of being left anxiously waiting to see a loved one for so long is not a nice experience. I also understand emergency situations occur meaning staff have their time further taken up. However, I saw plenty of staff around when I actually arrived - one of which was sat down around a nursing station area where I assume the buzzers are answered. Then, a person who looked like a doctor was leaving the building and without saying a word just swiped me into the building. How fortunate is it I have no intent to harm vulnerable patients as this would have been easy access to say the least.  
I then walked round to the ward as I assume I had to collect my dad and take him to the family room as I wasn’t given instructions to state otherwise. I was, again, allowed on the ward freely and could see my dad instantly as I arrived on the ward - he was looking upset and panicked. As I went to walk to get him and he was walking towards me a very abrupt and stern member of staff put their arm in front of my dad to stop him walking towards me and told me “quickly, come in”! “Shut the door quick!” And also tried to physically stop me entering as though my dad was an aggressive man trying to randomly leave the ward? When I explained that this was my dad and I was visiting him this staff member said they thought I was staff, and shouted that I had to get out! And walked towards me intimidatingly to usher me out. Again, how poorly regulated and how fortunate I wasn’t someone with intent to harm a vulnerable patient group.  
By this point my dad was saying “they’ve told me I don’t have a visitor” before the door was shut on us both. I would like to point out my dads section was lifted at this point. I understand now that visitors are not allowed on the ward having spoken to my mum who has visited several times, however this was not explained to me prior and no one would let me in the building or answer the buzzer to explain where I had to go. My dad was then escorted out to meet me where I was “greeted” by another abrupt and stern member of staff who literally shouted “TWO METRES” (as we walked on opposite sides of the corridor to one another).  
We were escorted to the family room where our time together had already been eaten into to then be greeted by a confused family member who rudely asked what we were doing there. Through an unpleasant interaction we found we had each been told that we had booked the room. The staff member heard this and said nothing.  
My dad, extremely upset, anxious and depressed having attempted suicide multiple times over the past few months in some horrific ways was mortified and already distressed by being told by staff that he never even had a visitor today - there had been a very clear cut lack of communication amongst staff. By this point I ended the visit with him and was too upset to even attempt speaking to the rude and unapproachable staff member that had escorted my dad out of the ward. I would also like to mention I was told to wear a mask upon entering the hospital and the family member who interrupted the time I had with my dad was not wearing one and had her arm around her family member in front of the staff member. I, on the other hand, had been shouted at like a child “TWO METERS” whilst walking on two separate sides of the corridor.  
My dad has described the hospital as a “prison” and told me “it depends who you get” “they are so disorganised and don’t communicate nicely” when I asked if the staff were treating him kindly. While I understand it is a secure unit for adult males who have been sectioned, this is disturbing to hear.  
As a an experienced student nurse I am beyond mortified and disgusted. Ironically, I had bought a box of chocolates and a card to give to staff as a gesture of appreciation for “caring” for him. I appreciate the hard work and determination it takes to be a nurse. How I wish I would have saved my money.  
I believe the staff on Rowan 1 need training on communication and how to speak to and treat people like autonomous, adult human beings. Pure insult to injury has been added to a truly traumatic time for us as a family. To be clear, I will be taking this as far as it needs to be taken and will not stop before we are given an apology and are told what is going to be done about the issues I have raised. I, for one, will always advocate for vulnerable patients who may not be able to speak up for themselves. There is no excuse for poor care, period.  
I have also witnessed staff members stood outside the ward smoking cigarettes and chatting away on their phone on their break where family members are entering and leaving. I agree with my dad in that the staff appear disorganised and unprofessional.  
After I wrote the above, I was shockingly informed by my mum that just before my dad left Rowan 1 he had a staff member come to him in a confrontational manner saying they had “beef" with him, accusing him of refusing his meds 3 times that morning, and in my dads words, was “in his face”. My dad was sleeping that morning due to sleeping tablets he has was given the night before having an effect and that is the reason he didn’t take his medication.  
Needless to say I was disgraced to say the least. My dad gave me the name of the member of staff who acted in this disgusting way towards him and I rang the ward wanting an explanation. A manager called me back after being in meetings all day and said, stuttering over themselves and clearly constructing a story as they went, my dad had maybe been taken the wrong way because the member of staff said “no beef" and had told him not to worry about not taking his medication that morning. The manager confirmed they were not there when it happened and they were going off what the staff member had told them.  
My dad would NEVER lie about something like that and is an extremely anxious and none confrontational person. Having seen how the staff there talk to people and how rude and unprofessional they came across to me I find it perfectly believable.  
I hope and pray that no one else’s family has to endure that kind of behaviour and go through what we have gone through and the hell my dad has had to endure at the worst time of his life.  
I am contemplating taking this to the care quality commission or at least the NMC. I hope members of the public see this and speak out at the first sign of something off on that ward.  
There are other scenarios I would like to complain about however I will leave it here as these are the ones that have stuck most in my head and upset me so much.

author: Beltrami
title: Tooth extraction
body: Amazing care at the Albion Dental Hospital in Glasgow today when I was getting my tooth extracted. The dentist and support staff were so kind and encouraging and made the process so much easier. Thank you so much.

author: Larst55
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Feel like I have not been forgotten
body:
Feel some frustration as not been able to have ongoing injections at the pain clinic which leaves me in pain, but with the situation as it is (with Covid) unsure what could have been done better. However feel like have not been forgotten and people are ringing to check on me.  
Equipment was provided very quickly by the therapy team and got a call back to check everything was okay, 'brilliant' thank you.

author: Larst55
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Service went remarkably well in the current circumstances
body:
Feel service went remarkably well in the current circumstances (with Covid), i contacted the red cross as i needed some equipment and they put me in contact with the therapy team. Following a phone call delivery was sorted out very quickly, there was a walking frame which i was unsure about the height of, but i received a follow up call from the team and a member of staff came to visit and checked/adjusted the height for me. It is also reassuring that i can contact the team if anything goes wrong with the walker and it needs replacing.  
If only the team could fix all the terrible pavements i have to walk along!!!

author: Larst55
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Absolutely wonderful service
body:
Absolutely wonderful service, all the support/care i receive from the district nurses is great, the therapy team provided equipment which has helped a lot.  
Have nothing negative to say about any of the services, thank you.

author: Music Maker
title: Bereavement
body: My mother passed away in February this year. She was 97 and my wife and I had been caring for her for a number of years. Over the previous three months we had been staying with her as she needed 24 hour care. Mum and my wife and I were very close and her passing has been very hard to cope with. I became depressed and unable to deal with everyday life. On the advice of my GP I contacted Bromley Talk Together who arranged a course of CBT through Silver Cloud.

author: Nic84
title: Anxiety struggles
body:
I was put in touch with Inclusion Thurrock to support me with my anxiety. I felt my therapist was a great fit for me and made me feel comfortable to share my emotions and experiences. She was very supportive and tailored my therapy to my emotional and psychical state, also involving me in what I wanted from therapy.  
The weekly checkins allowed me to share my highs and lows from the week and to discuss how the strategies where helping me cope with anxiety. I feel more in control of my anxiety and although it is still there, knowing why I feel a certain way has helped me to use the correct strategies to deal with it logically.  
I can not thank my therapist enough for her support and would recommend anyone dealing with similar illnesses to speak to someone and get the right support for them.

author: Dizzydawn
title: CGL treating alcoholism
body: Adrian at CGL has my husband in a therapy group called NAFFI BREAK. This is for ex service men who are all suffering with being alcoholics mostly because of the effect of their time in the armed services. It is doing my husband so much good,he really looks forward to it and the realisation that he is not the only one suffering in this way has really changed his attitude to life and alcohol and the light on the other side. I can’t thank Adrian and the CGL enough.not only have you got hubby wanting to live again,you have given me back the man I fell in love with 40 years ago

author: Carowils
title: I will forever be indebted to the team
body:
My 94 yr old mother was admitted in May to hospital and it was touch and go, without the love care and support of all the staff, Dr, Nurses, ancillary, Physios, OT etc mum would not be with us today.  
After nearly ten weeks the team on ward 201 will be discharging my mum home with a full care package. The support and care to not just my mum but to us as a family and in particular during these unprecedented times has been truly outstanding. I will forever be indebted to the team, It would be extremely unfair to single anyone one out, but the team work within this ward is truly outstanding, I am indebted And grateful to everyone Thank you Does not seem enough

readBy.name: Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration
